net.cloud.gfx.elements

Class TextArea

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.gfx.elements.AbstractElement
      • net.cloud.gfx.elements.TextArea
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Element, Focusable

    public class TextArea
extends AbstractElement
    A text area is a block of text. Unlike a Text label, a Text Area will utilize line breaks and make itself fit within a bounding width. The height on the other hand will change based on the space needs of the text.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.awt.Color color
      The color of the text
      private java.awt.Font font
      Font being used for the text
      private int lineHeight
      The maximum height of a line of text, for spacing out each line
      static int PRIORITY
      Default priority of Text.
      private java.lang.String text
      The actual text in the area
      private boolean updateNeeded
      A flag to track when the text has changed and the vectors need to be updated
      private java.util.List<java.awt.font.GlyphVector> vectors
      A series of glyph vectors that represent each line of text

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextArea

        public TextArea(java.lang.String text,
                int x,
                int y,
                int width)
        Create a TextArea with the given text in it. It will be placed at the given location and be bounded to the given width. The height will adjust itself to the needed height for all of the text. The font will be the default and the color will be black.
        Parameters:
        text - The text in the area
        x - X location
        y - Y location
        width - Bounding width of text

      • TextArea

        public TextArea(java.lang.String text,
                int x,
                int y,
                int width,
                java.awt.Font font,
                java.awt.Color color)
        Create a TextArea with the given text in it. It will be placed at the given location and be bounded to the given width. The height will adjust itself to the needed height for all of the text. The font and color will be those provided.
        Parameters:
        text - The text in the area
        x - X location
        y - Y location
        width - Bounding width of text
        font - The font to use
        color - The color of the text

    • Method Detail

      • drawElement

        public void drawElement(java.awt.Graphics g,
                        int offsetX,
                        int offsetY)
                 throws IteratorException
        Draw the text to the graphics. If an update is needed, the text area's layout will be updated before drawing.
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics object to draw to
        offsetX - How far off on the X axis this element is from the Graphic's origin
        offsetY - How far off on the Y axis this element is from the Graphic's origin
        Throws:
        IteratorException - If there was an issue iterating child elements

        Specified by:
        setRectangle in interface Element
        Overrides:
        setRectangle in class AbstractElement
        Parameters:
        r - The entire location rectangle, all in one

        public void setFontSize(int size)
        Change the size of the font in order to change how the text appears
        Parameters:

        Parameters:

      • update

        private void update(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d)
        If an update is needed, update the glyph vectors, and various text metrics. The update will clear the updateNeeded flag.
        Parameters:
        g2d - The graphics object currently being used to draw with

      • updateVectors

        private void updateVectors(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d)
        Update the glyph vectors by clearing them and then re-populating the list so that each vector is a line of text.
        Parameters:
        g2d - The graphics object currently being used to draw with

      • updateLineHeight

        private void updateLineHeight(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d)
        Update the line height variable to reflect the current maximum height of a line of text
        Parameters:
        g2d - The graphics object currently being used to draw with
